content.answer: The duties of equals are, to regard the dignity and worth of each other, in giving honor to go one before another; and to rejoice in each other's gifts and advancement, as their own.
content.name: Larger Catechism
content.question: What are the duties of equals?

content_with_prooftexts.answer: The duties of equals are, to regard the dignity and worth of each other,1 in giving honor to go one before another;2 and to rejoice in each other's gifts and advancement, as their own.3
content_with_prooftexts.name: Larger Catechism

prooftexts.1:
1 Peter 2:17

Honor everyone. Love the brotherhood. Fear God. Honor the emperor. (ESV)
prooftexts.2:
Romans 12:10

Love one another with brotherly affection. Outdo one another in showing honor.

Philippians 2:3

Do nothing from rivalry or conceit, but in humility count others more significant than yourselves. (ESV)
prooftexts.3:
Romans 12:15-16

Rejoice with those who rejoice, weep with those who weep. Live in harmony with one another. Do not be haughty, but associate with the lowly. Never be wise in your own sight.

Philippians 2:3

Do nothing from rivalry or conceit, but in humility count others more significant than yourselves. (ESV)

content_with_prooftexts.question: What are the duties of equals?

feed:
Larger Catechism

Q 131. What are the duties of equals?

A. The duties of equals are, to regard the dignity and worth of each other,1 in giving honor to go one before another;2 and to rejoice in each other's gifts and advancement, as their own.3

  1. 1 Peter 2:17

    Honor everyone. Love the brotherhood. Fear God. Honor the emperor. (ESV)

  2. Romans 12:10

    Love one another with brotherly affection. Outdo one another in showing honor.

    Philippians 2:3

    Do nothing from rivalry or conceit, but in humility count others more significant than yourselves. (ESV)

  3. Romans 12:15-16

    Rejoice with those who rejoice, weep with those who weep. Live in harmony with one another. Do not be haughty, but associate with the lowly. Never be wise in your own sight.

    Philippians 2:3

    Do nothing from rivalry or conceit, but in humility count others more significant than yourselves. (ESV)
title: What are the duties of equals?
